message:
[PHP coders only]
I never liked the idea of using a framework. Like many of us, I always had an opinion about everything in these frameworks, and I wanted things to be done MY way. 
After 7+ years writing PHP using my own frameworks (started with something called Unique, then Zonda and finally Rhino), I started looking at frameworks like Phalcon and Laravel, and I said to myself: it's time to use someone else 's code!
So, what is your framework of choice?
story: Ahmed Zain Mohammed created a poll in Egyptian Geeks.

data.message: I don't do PHP (so didn't answer), but I saw a lot of places (pretty much everywhere that talks about it, that I read) saying Laravel is the most popular.
Symfony is the best out there but it still depends upon your project. some projects does not need having even too fat frameworks and you may go for something like slim.
Can't Agree More with Alaa Attya Mohamed :)
Mohamed Meligy, Laravel is gaining traction, and it does use components from Symfony, but I still have a bad feeling about it (nothing that I can explain scientifically or methodically) :)

^ Popular does not mean best, specially in the PHP world.

One obvious example is Wordpress! It sucks on all technical levels, from architecture, to extensibility to utilizing resources to plugin compatibility to separation of concerns, etc. Yet, it is the most used PHP CMS out there!

WordPress is awesome. When I see all the ecosystems and business that were built on top of it, all the plugins that do everything I need.

And from being interested in startup and & marketing world, seeing all its enabling non-tech people to do from injecting landing pages to selling stuff to running online courses and much much more...
I am with Mosab Ahmad on this one. WordPress SUCKS big time on the technical level, the code is a mess! Yet, as a product it's great.

Laravel or Symfony 
Actually laravel is built on symfony components :) but more and more developer friendly

It depends on your use . If you prefere developer friendly powerful go for laravel if you want high performance micro framework there is slim and lumen . If you want to control every thing build your own using symphony componenets and composer for psr autoload
I'm looking forward to the advances of recent years shaping up into a new CMS that ordinary people can use and build with and that goes beyond and outperforms Wordpress
